caption: Beautiful building, part of westfield mall at WTC one. Not crowded, very clean and spacious.
They makes amazing seafood.
I had an awesome  at this restaurant. We liked the fantastic ambience and the menu. The staff are super attentive. I am glad we finally decided to visit this spot.

I celebrated my nomination earlier this evening in this delicious restaurant. I am glad to say that we had a terrific evening and the venue was evidently one of the reasons for the successful evening. The team  participated in a splendid manner, the food was tasty and my guests were extremely  delighted. We shall surely return for more events. Thank you very much.
(Translated by Google) High quality of raw materials and impeccable service.  (Original) Alta qualità delle materie prime e servizio impeccabile.

We came for a “meet the winemaker” dinner, which they have regularly. The only problem is that the winemaker was not there and was never meant to be there. Total bait and switch, which is unacceptable. Avoid the wine dinners, that’s my advice. Otherwise, the food was good, but not worth the journey.

A special evening with 3 incredibly special friends.  Osteria della Pace was one of the favorite restaurants of a mutual friend who is no longer with us...but, C was certainly with us in spirit!  The menu selections are very precise and have a reason to exist on the roster of choices.  Very limited number of dishes, assuring us of the peak of freshness and taste.  Began with shared appetizers of the grilled octopus, beets with endive and Burrata with diced pears.  Incredible!  The focaccia arrived twice, very generously.  A fine Rose, extremely well priced introduced  our entrees.  2 of my guests had pork, one had ravioli and I   indulged in penne with ragu.  And yes, we had a simple assortment of sorbets.  Service staff was very well paced, friendly, informed, and professional.  A beautiful table was reserved for us...hats off to our hostess, who so carefully assisted us in every way possible, knowing the occasion of our dining in this particular restaurant was of significant import.  Memorable, indeed!  Thank you all!!!
Considering the location and the view, the price is acceptable.  Good for date night. Of course, the meal was very delicious!
(Translated by Google) Very cozy, varied options of Italian cuisine. worth it  (Original) Muito aconchegante, opções variadas da culinária Italiana. Vale a pena

My out-of-town family and I had a lovely meal here, but after we split the bill, BOTH credit card numbers that were used to pay the bill were stolen and subsequently used fraudulently.  Though it's impossible to 100% prove that they were stolen at this restaurant, it's the only place both cards were used all year, and the fraudulent charges were for similar items on both cards. I'm really disappointed that I now feel like I can't trust Eataly anymore.

The waiter kept pouring water in our glasses. My meal was $25, water charges were $50. I wouldn’t go back because we asked for tap water, which is typically free. Really ruined my trip there and personally treatment like that would cause me not to go back, and of course, leave a review. Don’t let them refill your glass cz it was like $6 a cup!!! Tourists don’t get caught in this trap. NYC is so much better than unethical business practices like this sham! Tons of other places to eat that’s just as good.

I told my friends about this place with my warmest recommendations. I go their often. This recommendation is always successful. The the food there is great and the stuff is efficient and cooperative. Every time  we visit this place we enjoy a gorgeous evening.  warmly recommended.
Skip this place. Go to the regular seating area.
Had high hopes was standard sould have just eaten in the main area
Food and service are on point. Some of the best flavors from Italy without being in Italy.

While we were waiting the 60 minutes for a table, we found a corner opposite the bar for a glass of wine. As it turns out, a bottle from the $25/bottle list caught our eye.  The Sangiovese was delightful (especially compared to some of the glasses  priced at 17-21!  We also ordered the burrata appetizer which came with lovely house baked bread. Our table became ready, but we chose to stay at the lounge, and had the eggplant parmigiana stack, the ziti with veal and a side of greens (definitely enough for 2).  The service was well paced, giving us time to enjoy the burrata, conversation, wine, and enjoy the perfectly cooked mains once they arrived.  Our server, Carlos did an incredible job, even grating our cheese when the person running the food neglected to.   Phenomenal food, caring attentive service.

I normally always get consistently good food from Eataly around the world.  However in this restaurant we managed to sample 3 pastas.  The portions were very small for the price and they seemed to prefer to load us up on free breads instead.
Overpriced small portions. Would not return.
Wonderful food and view .

Amazing place!!! An excellent selection of many different foods and everything there from breakfast to lunch almost is excellent. I ordered my favorites cheese sandwich, chicken wings and the onion rings, which was delicious. I would highly recommend it.

Amazing place!!! An excellent selection of many different foods and everything there from breakfast to lunch almost is excellent. I ordered my favorites cheese sandwich, chicken wings and the onion rings, which was delicious. I would highly recommend it.
(Translated by Google) Preciously expensive. Unjustifiably. The portions are not equal who knows what.  (Original) יקר בטרוף. ללא הצדקה. המנות לא שוות מי יודע מה.
Wine is soooo overpriced. If you are looking for a nice pasta dish or pizza, head over to La Pasta La Pizza for slightly better rates, more options and wayyyy better flavors..
Overpriced, the service is terrible, and the food is very average. I've been there four times and I won't be back.
You're sitting among skyscrapers and eating fabulous food.
(Translated by Google) Good but expensive  (Original) Bueno pero caro
Great option for a fancy lunch. The seafood pasta was delicious! A bit on the pricey side though.
(Translated by Google) Good raw material Good drinks too. Very noisy. Expensive  (Original) Buena materia prima. Buenos tragos también. Muy ruidoso. Caro
Amazing experience. The cheese and meat trays where amazing. They paired very well with the wine.
A bit over priced the service was not very good.
(Translated by Google) Fantastic  (Original) Fantastico
Great!
You can't go wrong here!
Really good food
don't see the appeal and reason for this place popularity. very crowded. average food for masses.
Cool experience!
easy, casual, and delicious food.

Very Nice spot/view (thats the 1 star for) The food WOW: expensive, very small portions (in US turms: xxxxxs). The taste was Okay, not even great, and there were atleast 4 shrimps 😠 and that for $25,- Be real ! (I know NYC is expensive, but this is rubbish)  In the beginning the waitress was friendly, but after serving the food, we did not see her, and never asked how it was or tasted.  Only go for the view ! Not for the food.

(Translated by Google) One of the restaurants of Eataly in New York located in a skyscraper next to the World trae center. Great food nice local friendly and helpful staff.  (Original) Uno dei ristorantini di Eataly a New York situato in un grattacielo a fianco del World trae center. Cibo ottimo bel locale personale gentile e disponibile.
Great food. Great views.

Excellent Italian restaurant on Freedom Plaza, inside Eataly building. Any kind of pasta is home made from scratch and prepared in full respect of the Italian recipe (rare in USA). The quality of meat is absolutely above average and the wine list is set to match any choice in the menu. Flawless service, fine view from the large windows (all glass walls, superb point of view). Round tables on the corners fit for 7-8 people parties. Fair pricing given the quality.
Nice views & nice restaurant.
Best pasta I have had the pleasure of eating.
The best restaurant in NYC for italians

The Osteria restaurant is situated above H&M. It was extremely busy and I found it noisy in the main hall. To the far end is a small and quiet restaurant on offer which was a better choice for me. The service, food price was excellent. I would highly recommend Osteria

friendly, fast service. really delicious salad-- very fresh and diverse ingredients. very good roast potatoes. excellent coffee. less crazy than the rest of the eataly space, nice sit-down dining experience.
Amazing ambience and food. Very busy and worth the wait.
Nice Italian restaurant with the trully outstanding service.

Service is really bad. It Takes forever for drinks (beer & wine) to arrive. Waitress asked for ID, after we prior showed the ID to the waitor, who took the order. While looking at IDs she poured beer in the glasses and overdid it, so it all ran down the table onto our wardrobe. This happened twice in a row. She asked if wardrobe was okay and offered help, so that's a little plus. Waiters & waitresses seem to be nice, but the service is more like calling someone if you want something and not like the staff asking the customers if everything is ok, etc.. The high tables are also kinda wobbly, therefor when you cut food like pizza, you don't want to have full glasses on the table. The food is OK. not great. But considering the price it's heavily overpriced. Seriously you pay twice for the location and triple for the name. Drinks are aswell really really expensive. I would not recommend to go there.
(Translated by Google) He eats very well and with very good views, that's a bit expensive.  (Original) És menja molt bé i amb molt bones vistes,això sí una mica car.
A great place for lunch. Amazing views over the memorial site and great fresh pasta.
(Translated by Google) If you are Italian but not alone and you are in NY to try absolutely  (Original) Se siete italiani ma non solo e siete a NY da provare assolutamente
Best bartenders ever!
(Translated by Google) Nice bar suffers very loud  (Original) Schöne Bar leidet sehr laut
Great food and wine

Excellent Saltimbocca alla Romana! And in general I absolutely recommend Eataly for any Italian foodie out there!  Osteria della Pace restaurant has an amazing view and it's really charming both during the day and in the night.
Good atmosphere and view.

I’m kind of torn writing this review because many things had the potential to be good, but the few things that went wrong really put me off so I split the difference at 3 stars.  I came here for an afternoon lunch in a party of four. I’ve been to Eataly in the past and enjoyed my experience. What changed was trying to visit an Italian restaurant on a diet with specific restrictions.  The first issue was my order - a salad - arrived almost 10 minutes after the rest of my groups hot pasta dishes.  I couldn’t snack on the complimentary bread since I’m eating gluten and dairy free.  I dove into the salad starved, only to discover it contained walnuts - which I specifically asked to be removed when placing the order. (The waiter admitted his mistake. )  To make matters worse, the “poached tuna” was absolutely disgusting. I had googled it prior to ordering, and I was expecting something different. I thought it was fresh tuna, poached to warm it up a bit. I got slimy and extremely  salty pieces of fish. Not Osterias fault but it led to me decide not to try to eat the rest of the meal after a few bites.  Management decided to treat my table to deserts. A tirimisu topped with chocolate and some ice cream. I’m dairy free and allergic to chocolate. Not to mention I’m on a f*ing diet which is why I ordered salad in the first place.  In the end they removed my salad from the bill, which is good since it was wrong and I didn’t eat a meal. My personal experience was 1 star as I left hungrier than I arrived.  But ... My party had three wonderful pasta dishes, yummy cocktails, and complimentary fresh bread, and deserts (courtesy of my order mix up). They even took special care to check for my fathers food allergy and when it got too sunny they lowered the shades. Which for them would’ve been a 5-star experience (had I not been hangry at the table.  So yea.
Have been twice. Food was so-so. Wine was pretty good but service was very slow.

Beautiful restaurant, great views of the city below. Lovely decor and wine selection. Appetizers and appetizer specials were great. Mussels were Devine. Gnocchi was very good. I wish I got the simple tomato spaghetti instead of the lobster cognac risotto, the presentation of the risotto could’ve been better, could’ve also used some fresh herbs on top or some colorful sauce, it looked like gray slush. It was a bit too al dente. Peroni was yummy, the service was very good. The bread that came on the side was warm and yummy.
Wonderful food and view.  Good service.  Expensive but worth it.
Great views over the city, the stuff is Italian and food tastes just like in Italy.
The brown butter lemon ravioli, the mushroom burrata appetizer, and the thyme cocktail were delicious! The gnocchi were a little too dense for my taste. Nice service.
The food is amazing

I’m a frequent visitor of Eataly but this was my first time coming to their Italian restaurant. We came for restaurant week and it was definitely worth it! Authentic, delicious, cute little restaurant in the back of Eataly with million dollar views of lower Manhattan. Stop here for a bite!

Wouldn't recommend to go... food was so so, we ordered burrata cheese and froed calamari as appetizers. Calamari was so so and burrata cheese was the only dish I enjoyed through the whole night. I order lobster risotto, because risotto is my favorite dish and if I'll tell you that it had no taste, literally tasted like a paper.
Very hot sauce! And great wine and linguine, also a fantastic view!
Excellent food and service
Delicios food and really nice ambiance. Amazing view of the WTC area from the windows, the staff was really nice.
Inside eatery called EATALLY. Upscale italian restaurant  with very nice ambience. Private siting even its part of eatally market. Nice wine list. Good food. We liked it.
Very good Italian food. Worth it all.
(Translated by Google) I would love to be able to give this flavor here but it is not possible ....  (Original) Gostaria muito de poder dar está sabor aqui mas não é possivel ....
Pricey but excellent food and drinks.
The food was delicious. Staff was great. I will definitely visit again. Also the Italian market is great.

(Translated by Google) On the evening of December 24 I was with my family for dinner at this restaurant; carry with a few exceptions, very bad; perhaps we have trimmed inventions because many times we were told that the kitchen closed at 10 pm, expensive and not up to the price. The only positive note is the location: world trade center  (Original) La sera del 24 Dicembre sono stato con la mia famiglia a cena in questo ristorante; portate  tranne alcune eccezioni, pessime; forse ci hanno rifilato rimanenze visto che più volte ci hanno detto che la cucina chiudeva alle 22;costoso e non all'altezza del prezzo. Unica nota positiva la localizzazione: world trade center
Very rude reception!!!!! All she knows is NO when I asked her about reservations .
Great food, services, pricey, and view of the World Trade Center is amazing The staff is very friendly and professional, Nice atmosphere.

Overall impression: underwhelming, a little loud, & does not prepare seafood well  Located inside Eataly,  the dining area is busy but not overly crowded.  I dined at around 1 PM and the crowd was a bit loud.  I haven't eaten here before so I can only judge the dishes I tried today. The Spaghettoni ai Tre Pomodori was very oily with a small amount of shellfish. The shellfish was sandy and rubbery from being overcooked. The sauce has red pepper flakes in it and my dish came with a clump of them which I didn't notice until my mouth was aflame. The Capesante e Topinambur came with 4 very plump scallops which were cooked to perfection but were incredibly salty and sandy. The sunchokes didn't have any salt and so when the scallops & sunchokes were eaten together, the level of seasoning was fine. I like to eat separate bites of the dish and not mash everything together so I won't be ordering this again.

Pretty amazing view of the WTC while enjoying pretty traditional italian food. For an Italian it's a bit disorienting because the restaurant is American after all, so the way the menu is written, the way the tables are set and orders are taken, etc still work like an American restaurant. To give a couple of examples, some Italian recepies vary wildly across regions and they are not always specified (they were all delicious nevertheles), Italians also put a lot of emphasis on table preparation while here it was pretty bare bones, but despite this shuffling of cultures it was still really cozy, the staff was extremely nice to us and c'mon the food was great.

(Translated by Google) The restaurant charges an 18% tip even on the value of the government rate, which is totally wrong. And if you refuse to pay this "excess" and pay that 18% tip on the total service (excluding gov tax), the waitress has the rudeness of coming to your table to charge .... Surreal ...  (Original) O restaurante cobra gorjeta de 18% inclusive sobre o valor da taxa governamental, o que é totalmente errado.  E se você se recusar a pagar esse "excesso" e pagar a tal gorjeta de 18% sobre o total do serviço (excluindo a gov tax), a waitress tem a grosseria de vir à sua mesa cobrar....   Surreal...
Consistently good food and service
Cozy fine dining with great views and a perfectly-executed, well-edited menu. Strong wine list and great service.

This space is more completely separated from the store than the other options in Eataly, so it feels more like a real restaurant even if there's still a whiff of "Ikea cafeteria." Food and wine were very good and price appropriate and there are ample gluten-free choices. As of yesterday at least, they also have a special seasonal white truffle menu, where you can pay twelve bucks a gram to have these delicious fungi shaved atop your entree. Good spot for a somewhat upscale lunch.
Seemed overpriced for what we got. We opted for expensive Italian wine and it was a bit of a disappointment.
Pretty good food and excellent service. I wasn’t a fan of the calamari but the pastas were delicious and decently sized.
Good linguine with lobster!
Beautiful views and great food.
Great food, great service, great view. And the whole Eataly market is a beautifull place.
Excellent experience, very Nice place good food and Nice staff. Marvelous view. Inside the Eataly

(Translated by Google) It is an excellent place to eat authentic Italian food, all its products are Italian, even its own "coca-cola" Good attention in several languages The price is quite high in the value for money, you also pay that it is located in zone 0 of New York, next to the 11s memorial Located on the first floor of the eataly  (Original) Es un excelente sitio para comer autentica comida italiana, todos sus productos son italianos, hasta su propia “coca-cola” Buena antencion en varios idiomas El precio es bastante alto en la relacion calidad precio, pagas tambien que este ubicado en la zona 0 de new york, junto al memorial del 11s Ubicado en la primera planta del eataly
Says they are open at 11:30 so we went and they were in a meeting and employees in next door restaurant said they should have been open ...
nice bustling restaurant with nice dishes. some excellent, some ok
Average food at best, and very pricey. Pleasant atmosphere and nice staff, though. Good cocktails. Sit at the bar, have a drink! The view is nice.
Cozy, but great fine dining experience. I recommend ODP for everyone.

Great food, services, and view of the World Trade Center. The dinner menu is unique but dishes are a bit overpriced. Antipastis are from $18-25. Pasta/Risotto are $25-40. I've had better Italian food in little Italy that are maybe less trendy but serve better food.
Great experience all around
Simply wonderful experience at this elegant yet welcoming spot.
The name says it all. Good italian food in a peaceful environment with a good view! Prices are ok in relation to the quality of the products and the service!
Nice place.
Located at the downtown eataly (which is less crowded then flatiron). Very nice dining area with a view. Good pasta dishes and the pork was excellent. Reservations definitely recommend.
A cheap way to get a Batali meal in nyc
Very high end if that's what ur looking for.
Great restaurant inside of eataly NY.  Every dish is priced affordably and they are fantastic.
Great

Excellent view. Great settings. Also it is quieter in comparison to other restuarants located in Eatitaly and I greatly appreciate this. The ablity to hear everyone in the party now a days seems to becoming rare. It is on the pricey side, but the service is fantastic. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 is because the food was good, but not great, as we were expecting. You can relay on this opinion since I brought there a group of 4 native Italians. On the other hand the wine and gelato were exquisite.
Great service.  Excellent food
The soft shell crab was to die for

(Translated by Google) If the first impression of the place captivates you, it will be the same with the food and the service. The menu is very well selected and perfectly accompanied by a wine list honoring Italian cuisine. The staff is warm and you feel welcome from their first gesture of service.  (Original) Si la primera impresión del lugar te cautiva, será lo mismo con la comida y el servicio. El menu está muy bien seleccionado y perfectamente  acompañado de una carta de vinos honrrando a la cocina italiana. El staff es cálido y te sientes bienvenido desde su primer gesto de servicio.
Poor service, appetizer portions served as entres. Four adults dined for 317; family went home hungry and ate pizza- Tourist trap

Absolutely delicious! Late night dining, and it was walking distance from my hotel. A bit pricey, I think I had one cocktail, one glass of wine, Pasta Bolognese, plus an appetizer and with tax and gratuity it was about $110.
Spacious layout with great food
Delicious and a beautiful ambiance overlooking WTC. Nice wine list as well.
Not going to lie, pretty much a tourist trap at night when everyone is coming back from the Brooklyn bridge viewpoint. Nevertheless very delicious food, quick service, but overpriced.
Attentive service, decent wine list, delicious food. It is an upscale dining experience that is appropriate for both business and pleasure with beautiful views of the city.
Food was nice but expensive.
Great location in the financial quarter. The staff was very kind and the food is delicious. I highly recommend this place.

I was disappointed with Eataly's sit-down restaurant Osteria della Pace. The portions are large but the food is bland. I ordered the beet salad which held such promise with the impressive list of ingredients. However, the dressing was underwhelming and i needed to add some balsamic vinegar to make it flavorful. We sat in a small dining room which was pretty and quiet. The service was slow which we didn't mind because we were nit in a rush. I would stick with the other food options in Eataly

What a different restaurant! The design, service, food... combination of pasta, seafood and poultry cuisine! Service was delightful! Service was outstanding, the view of the Hudson River and the area is wonderful! Their lounge area before going to your table is comfortable and welcomed!
Average restaurant. Scallops were not so tender, pasta is average, with seafood - not many seafood, tagliatelle al ragu is average, pork loin was good, octopus comes with potato pure (?) strange.

Service was great, don’t know what these other reviewers are talking about! Pasta was fresh as can be, yum yum! Fish “for two” can serve 3 or 4. Tiramisu was forgettable but we will be back for sure! Grazie mille!

While restaurant week felt like a great deal, I'm not sure the food I got would be a great value at its original retail price. That being said, the cocktails were delicious and the service was friendly if a little loud (I was seated near the POS terminal, so I heard a lot of staff convos). I was especially into the buffala mozzarella appetizer.

Bad service, they kick you out once the market closes. We were seated almost a half hour after our reservation, around 9 for an 8:30 reservation. It was fine until around 10:15pm they started shutting down. There were still other patrons at tables but they took everyones unfinished dishes and glasses without asking if done. They put the chairs on all the tables that were empty. They told us we needed to leave with 'c'mon ladies! We have to close!' It makes sense, this isn't a restaurant but a supermarket that serves food. Once the market closes, they kick you out. We paid $100pp but we were such an inconvenience to them. Food was subpar. The gnocchi shouldn't be called gnocchi. It's a shame bc the venue is nice.
Had a great salad! The Risotto could be better. The ambience is great.

The food, the staff and the ambience help make this restaurant and bar the jewels of the FiDi Eataly. The bar is my after work "go to".  Tara and Sean are consummate mixologists. Tonight I sampled the Hot Sicilian, a creative hot toddy with Avena, bourbon  and honey tea. It went down mighty smooth. The pasta dishes in the restaurant (or at the bar) are super yummy. I'm also partial to the cheese plates.
Horrible service....too bad. Decent food.
Disappointing....one of my negative NYC experiences.  If got want to be served and valued as a customer.... go elsewhere. 12.26.17

Here, still, about an hour after being done with our meal. Our waiter disappeared mid-meal And manager stood around unhelpful. Waited 35 minutes to get our checks settled and change back. VERY poor staff, the food was great but never coming here again.
Great service and very good, real Italian food. Great views too. Good place for a business lunch.

Wonderful downtown authentic Italian! Great fresh ingredients, perfect execution. The food was both exciting and comforting. Went for a family lunch, and it would also be great for romantic dinner or business entertaining. The staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. The atmosphere is fine dining with fantastic views, separate for the hustle and bustle of the main Eataly market.
This review is for the bar area only. Great drinks and service in a relaxed atmosphere.
Delicious food and beautiful space!
Came here for several times coz it's so close to where I stay. Decent decor, delicate seafood, and authentic Italian pasta! But good price too..

I am not one to complain, but I was very disappointed in this restaurant.  I have frequented many of Lidia's restaurants before so I had high hopes.  First of all the service was terrible.  The waitress never introduced herself, and I had to ask her for water several times.   She brought over a wooden board for bread, but we never received the bread till after our dinners were served.   The olive oil that comes with the bread is very good, but make sure you ask them to fill the very small bowl, because it is not enough for 3 people.  My wife had a glass of wine and the waitress took her  empty glass away after appetizers and never asked her if she would like another glass of wine with her dinner.  My mom's sparkling water cost more than my wife's glass of wine, which is absolutely absurd.  The grilled octopus was tasty, but a bit too salty for my taste buds.  The red snapper was not cooked thoroughly.  I did not care for the puree with the snapper.  My mom had the linguine and clams and she did say it was fresh and tasty.  There is no salt, pepper or cheese on tables.  You need to ask for this and then have to wait.   Apparently, after dinner the shift changed and the waitress that we had left and we had someone else.  We had coffee, cappuccino and dessert.  There was no milk for coffee and so we asked the server to please bring it.  He forgot and continued to clean tables around us.  By the time we received the milk the coffee was getting cold and no spoons were given with the coffee to stir.  I hope that this review helps the manager who is running this restaurant.  This was not an off day.  Not one person who waited on us was pleasant, or helpful.  I would not frequent this restaurant again.

Beautiful interior with beautiful views of downtown financial district. All pasta dishes were filled with flavor and beautifully plated. My personal favorite was the red snapper that was placed on top of a sweet potato purée. The service was very attentive for our large party and helpful selecting entrees, wine and apps.

Getting to the restaurant required going through most of Eataly, which was fun, seeing all the things on offer. The restaurant is situated in the corner of the building giving you great views of the 9/11 memorial area and the surrounding financial district.  Going for lunch we nonetheless decided to go for a 3-course meal.  We all started off with the octopus which was absolutely perfect. I could have eaten this dish all day long. Probably, the best preparation of octopus I've eaten.  Unfortunately, things went downhill from that point. We all went for different pastas, but none of us were thrilled by them, they were standard pasta dishes that you could get pretty much anywhere. The portion sizes weren't great and overly expensive.  For dessert the panna cotta was okay, but the accompanying side that came with it was absolutely gross. Kept trying to figure out what they were trying to achieve in terms of taste but gave up as it was totally disgusting. The chocolate dessert was okay but again nothing to shout about.  The service was pleasant and the restaurant wasn't too noisy, even though it was full.  It's just a shame the food wasn't better after the first course and the expensive prices didn't help, which turned it into a slightly disappointing experience.
Fantastic food!
